column128:
Cheltenham Festival 2014

Tuesday 11th March - Friday 14th March

In the interest of safety, passengers heading to the Cheltenham Festival are required to join a queuing system.  This is to ensure passenger volumes are manged safely at Platform level.

On arrival into the station please follow the signage arrows to the queuing system.

On Sunday 28 April 2013, Network Rail reached the half way point of the project. There are three new entrances therefore you will need to allow a little extra time should you not be familiar with the new station. 

If your changing trains at New Street, please allow a 12 minute minimum connection time

For further information please visit newstreetnewstart.co.uk.

Tickets Accepted with ScotRail

All First Class.

Advance Loyalty Club members can also use all ScotRail First Class Lounges on presentation of their membership card as well as ANY type of ticket valid for travel on ScotRail services that day. Tickets not valid on ScotRail services cannot be accepted

Tickets Accepted with East Coast

  • Fully inter-available First Class Season Ticket (ie tickets not specific to one train company)
  • Any First Class Anytime ticket valid for travel on the East Coast route.
  • Any East Coast First Class packages.
  • Holders of a First Class Lounge supplement, available for purchase with a East Coast First Advance ticket or First Class reader offer.

Restricted tickets with East Coast

  • All First Advance tickets (unless accompanied by a First Class Lounge Upgrade)
  • All tickets with Weekend First supplements.
  • All First Class tickets valid only on other train operators, including ScotRail Sleepers

No Public Vehicle Access from 20 January 2014

From Monday 20 January, no private vehicles will be permitted access. Only taxis with security clearance and an electronic permit will be able to proceed beyond the security measures. A number of dedicated disabled travel service vehicles will also be granted access.

  • New drop off points are available on Calton Road and Market Street.
  • 30 Minutes free parking within New Street Car Park for drop off and pick up.
  • All 5 entrances now have step free access.

column57:
Located

Platform 1

Tickets Accepted

All First Class

 

Facilities

The First Class lounge offers the choice of a modern, comfortable bar area or the traditional, Victorian feel lounge.

 

The modern extension has armchairs and tables with a bar offering complimentary refreshments. It also has workstations with access to the Internet.

There is a large screen TVs showing Sky News and also a departures board showing train times.

The Victorian lounge offers old world splendour and comfort, with large armchairs and soft lighting, making it the perfect area to relax.

 

There is also a pre-bookable conference room which can seat up to eight people. Call 0207 313 1109 for more information.

Refreshments

Bar offering complimentary refreshments

Wi-Fi 

Available

Showers

Available

Concessions for Standard Class sleeper customers

Yes

column43:
Platforms 1-4 and 11-13, along with the domestic departures areas are managed by High Speed 1 (London and Continental Stations).

Platforms 5-10 and the international departures areas are managed by Eurostar.

Platforms A and B and the areas on the low level part of St Pancras, are managed by Network Rail.

column105: The station entrances are located at street level and provide level access to the lower concourse. There are three lifts on the main concourse to take passengers to and from the upper level UK train platforms and the Rendezvous.
column109:
A clearly marked passenger drop off zone is located on Pancras Road which runs parallel to St Pancras International Station.

The drop off zone leads directly to the Eurostar departures.
column116: To the rear of the ground and first level of the car park.
column121:
Midland Road: Currently the taxi pick up is located next to First Capital Connect station entrance. Soon a large covered queuing area will be available halfway along the lower concourse where passengers can wait for marshalled taxis.

Pancras Road: There are two taxi drop off areas in Pancras Road. One is situated halfway along the old Victorian brick built Barlow shed and is convenient for Eurostar passengers. The second is situated close to the main entrance in the new part of the station and is suitable for passengers travelling within the UK .
column123: The underground station Kings Cross St Pancras leads directly into St Pancras International and is better connected than any other London station with 6 of the major tube lines running through it - Victoria, Hammersmith and City, Piccadilly, Circle Metropolitan line and Northern. Please refer to Transport for London for journey times.
column124:
Heathrow Airport: There is a direct journey to Heathrow Airport, using the Piccadilly Line. Journey time is under an hour.

The quickest transfer from St Pancras to Heathrow Airport is to catch the Heathrow Express from London Paddington to Heathrow Airport.

Gatwick Airport: St Pancras offers a direct route from St Pancras to Gatwick Airport from Platform A.

Stansted Airport: The fastest option is to take Victoria Line to Tottenham Hale and change for the Stansted Express train. Journey time, approximately one hour.

Luton Airport: A direct train service operates from St Pancras to Luton Airport Parkway several times an hour.
column128:
This station is available for Eurostar services.

Southeastern now operate high speed services to/from this station.

If travelling to/from Stratford International station please note there is now a step free route between that station and Stratford Regional station through the new Westfield Shopping Centre, which takes about 10 minutes. There is no longer any bus link to/from Stratford Regional station.

There is level access from all platforms to the main concourse.

There is level access to the station via Exits 1 (Station approach), Exit 2 (via lifts to Waterloo Road and level Access to the Jubilee line), Exit 3 (for taxis and Station Reception)

Passengers transferring between Waterloo and Waterloo East please note: special arrangements apply while improvement work is undertaken from 29 May for about 8 weeks. The main lift will be out of use during this period but we have provided an alternative lift and additional staff to escort you. Please visit the information point or speak to a member of the station team if you are unable to use the escalators and require lift access.

column122:
'First' and 'Stagecoach' operate a network of frequent local bus routes around Manchester city and Greater Manchester. For route maps and timetables:

www.firstgroup.com/ukbus and www.stagecoachbus.com

 

Buy a Manchester PLUSBUS ticket with your train ticket, for discount price unlimited bus travel around the city. For details:

www.plusbus.info

 

The No 1 and No 3 free 'Metroshuttle' bus services link the main rail stations and various attractions in the city centre. Buses run daily      Mon-Fri 07:00 to 20:00.  Sat-Sun 08:00-2000

 

Oxford Road Link (147) bus service located in Fairfield Street > universities and central manchester hospitals

More details: www.route147.co.uk

 

For information about all buses in Greater Manchester visit:

www.gmpte.com
column123:
The Manchester 'Metrolink' tram network serves Picaddilly station. Trams go North to Bury, Rochdale and Ashton-under-Lyne and South West to Altrincham, East Disbury and Eccles.

For details: www.metrolink.co.uk
column124: Nearest Airport is Manchester International Airport approximately 9 - 10 miles away. There are 6 trains an hour during the course of the day, services are limited throughout the night.
column126: Two agents available within walking distance of the station.

column32: Oyster pay as you go and Travelcards on Oyster are not aviable on Southeastern high speed services. Oyster is valid on Docklands Light Railway services
column105:
Passengers are advised to walk through the new Westfield shopping centre (access is available through the Lower Ground Floor) which is about a ten minute walk and does not involve steps, lifts or escalators.

Alternatively, you can use Docklands Light Railway services which are a 2 minute walk from the High Speed station entrance), which take passengers directly to Stratford Regional station (a charge is payable - 2 minute journey) or further onto the London Underground network.
column121: Taxis are available from the Westfield Shopping Centre entrance.
column123: Docklands Light Railway is available at the station for onward connection to London Underground and DLR stations.
column128:
Southeastern operate high speed services to / from this station.

To travel between Stratford International and Stratford Regional station, passengers are advised to walk through the Westfield shopping centre (access is available through the Lower Ground Floor) which is about a ten minute walk and does not involve steps, lifts or escalators.

Alternatively, you can use Docklands Light Railway services which are a 2 minute walk from the High Speed station entrance), which take passengers directly to Stratford Regional station (a charge is payable) or further onto the London Underground network.
